alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 9:00PM CDT until May 18 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. Minnesota River at Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Chippewa, Lac qui Parle and Yellow Medicine Counties. .Additional rainfall on Saturday will either prolong current river crests or lead to additional rises. Widespread rain is likely along and south of the Minnesota River on Saturday, but how much falls and where within this region is still uncertain. The locations of the heaviest rainfall will key in determining where the greatest river rises will occur. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.1 feet, Flood waters begin to impact Cottonwood Street west of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 800 PM CDT Friday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to maintain near a crest of 12.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 06/24/2011. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
